fields.description:
I have created a local git repository for an RStudio project. When I use {{git remote add origin...}}, using the code given by you all, I get the following error:

fatal: remote origin already exists.

Then, when I try {{git push -u origin --all}}, I get the following:

Permission denied (publickey).\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights\\
and the repository exists.

I can see the repo I created on the Bitbucket website, but I'm not sure if it's a firewall issue on my end.

Thanks,\\
Will
fields.summary: fatal: remote origin already exists.

fields.description:
To synchronize, for instance, Pull Request and Commit records for an internal metrics tool, there does not appear to be a good, clean way to filter for just the records that have changed since the last synchronization run without walking the entire set of pages for each endpoint, resulting in undesired API traffic.  I'd like to be able to provide a search parameter to only return records that have changed since a certain point.

It's likely possible to get everything I need triggered with hooks (at least for commits and pull requests), but I didn't see an endpoint to configure hooks on repositories.  Given a large number of private repositories, I'm not overly excited about the change management that would be needed to ensure each repository always gets the correct hooks enabled.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add "Updated Since" parameter to REST API query endpoints (BB-13571)

fields.description:
Hi,

I have:

# Created an empty repository in my bitbucket account
# Generated the ssh key par on my computer (Yosemite) with 'ssh-keygen'
# Created the 'config' file under .ssh directory and added the corresponding entry
# Added my private key with 'ssh-add' and make sure is listed under 'ssh-add -l'
# Add the public key to the list of SSH Keys in my bitbucket account.
# Make sure the 'ssh-agent' is running in my computer

Well, I try then to ssh to bitbucket with no avail. It refuses to connect. If I try:

{code}
#!bash

ssh -T git@bitbucket.org
Connection closed by 131.103.20.167
{code}

I issued the command:

{code}
#!bash

ssh -Tv git@bitbucket.org
{code}

and got the following:

{code}
#!bash

OpenSSH_6.2p2, OSSLShim 0.9.8r 8 Dec 2011
debug1: Reading configuration data /Users/myself/.ssh/config
debug1: /Users/myself/.ssh/config line 1: Applying options for bitbucket.org
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh_config
debug1: /etc/ssh_config line 20: Applying options for *
debug1: /etc/ssh_config line 102: Applying options for *
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [131.103.20.168] port 22.
debug1: Connection established.
debug1: identity file /Users/myself/.ssh/bitbucket_rsa type 1
debug1: identity file /Users/myself/.ssh/bitbucket_rsa-cert type -1
debug1: Enabling compatibility mode for protocol 2.0
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_6.2
debug1: Remote protocol version 2.0, remote software version OpenSSH_5.3
debug1: match: OpenSSH_5.3 pat OpenSSH_5*
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT sent
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT received
debug1: kex: server->client aes128-ctr hmac-md5 none
debug1: kex: client->server aes128-ctr hmac-md5 none
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_REQUEST(1024<1024<8192) sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_GROUP
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_INIT sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_REPLY
Connection closed by 131.103.20.168
{code}

It seems it gets stuck with "expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_REPLY".

I do not understand what is happening, as for example, I have no problem in connecting with my GitHub account.

Thanks

fields.description:
Sometimes an issue gains a lot of attention, and people simply comment '+1' to show they would like the feature/fix to be implemented. However, this sends out a notification to all watchers on the current issue, to the annoyance of everyone. Often times there will be pleading to stop, which usually has little effect. This is especially bad on older issues which have hundreds of watchers.

See for example [here|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2874/ability-to-search-source-code-bb-39], and [here|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2323/create-a-way-to-group-repositories].

I would suggest some automated moderation here. If a user goes to comment with only the text '+1' (or similar potentially), instead we should intercept the user when they attempt to submit their comment, and tell them to vote or watch the issue instead.
fields.summary: Remove ability to comment '+1' on issues

:password => "xxxxxxxx"\\

fields.description:
After a pull-request has been approved, it wasn't merged at the same moment, because we have two persons, who must approve a pull-request before it will be merged.\\
After the first person approval, the author of the request is able to push new commits which can considerably change the previously approved code. The author can push to the approved request either because of new bugs found by the second code-reviewer, or by any other reason.

Our strongly desired suggestion is to reset the approved state of the request if any new pushes are made to this request.
fields.summary: Reset approve for pull-request after changes in branch before merge pull-request

fields.description:
Hello,

I hope that you create a feature in Bitbucket that enables deploying source code from a central  Bitbucket repo (either private or public) to a live server. The feature would satisfy the following requirements:

# Deployment is either manual (i.e, I can manually deploy changes, and not automatically push them immediately as they become ready), or automatic (i.e., automatically push changes to the live production server whenever the central repo is updated). Manual vs. automatic choice is based on setup.
# Pushing code results in updated changes, without a copy of the repo files (no .git or .hg directory). This is a security feature, no need to have full history in a live server
# When in manual mode, be able to push a certain version (not necessarily the latest).
# Be able to push via SSH.

This would help tremendously in deploying source code, and helps integrate production environment with Bitbucket.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Manually and Automatically Deploy Code from Bitbucket to a Production Server (BB-13566)

fields.description:
When a line with a comment is modified by new commits, the comment is still accessible with the small button next to "Side-by-side diff". The button shows the number of hidden (old) comments.  When that button is clicked a modal is spawned containing those hidden comments. If there are more comments then can fit on the screen, we can't scroll up and down.

Please allow scrolling when the model pops up. Either with a scroll bar or full page scrolling.
fields.summary: Allow scrolling in pull request comment modals. (BB-13091)

fields.description:
When a Pull request is merged, Bitbucket must check all Pull requests open for the given destination branch to ensure that all other Pull Requests are still in a consistent state, and update them if they are not. While this check is happening, all other Pull request merging is temporarily locked until the Pull requests have all been checked and updated.

On a Repository with _many_ (50+) open Pull requests against the same branch, users may experience the following behavior:

* A user merges any given Pull request, this one will be pretty quick
* Any subsequent attempt to merge a _different_ Pull request will take a little while in relation to the total number of open Pull requests against that branch.

As a workaround, fewer Pull requests against the same branch will result in quicker merges. The Bitbucket team is aware of this issue and is investigating ways to improve this essential process.
fields.summary: Merging multiple Pull requests at once on a Repository with many open Pull requests against the same branch may be slow (BB-13082)

fields.description:
The "View raw commit" link on any commit reveals the e-mail of the author of the commit, regardless of the user's "Private profile" checkbox settings (in the Account settings page).

The "View raw commit" is also enabled for visitors who browse the repositories anonymously, as well as for unpolite robots.

It'll be much more secure if users have the ability to hide Raw Commit details.
fields.summary: Improvement Request: The ability to hide author details & email in Raw Commits (BB-13093)

fields.description:
Right now accessing a private URL results in '403 Forbidden Error' if the logged in user doesn't have access to the repo. Without logging in, it will redirect you to the login page. While if you try to access a non-existent URL, you get 404 page.

Exploiting the above, you can potentially know if a user / organisation has a private repo with some name or not, which I think should not be public information. I won't say they can do much by knowing that, but I wouldn't want them to know even the private repo names of my organisation.

for example, try accessing\\
https://bitbucket.org/syst3mw0rm/secret\\
https://bitbucket.org/syst3mw0rm/non-existent\\
(I'd expect both URLs to return 404)

P.S: github always returns 404 if the user doesn't have permission to the repo.
fields.summary: Return 404 for private repo URLs when user doesn't have permission to access it.

fields.description:
To avoid confusion over having a public vs. private repository, I think we should change the interface slightly:

Right now we display a lock next to a "private" repository and no lock for a public repository. This isn't always as clear as it should be, so I propose a couple possible changes:

* Use lozenges stating "public" or "private" next to the repository on the dashboard
* Per https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2323/create-a-way-to-group-repositories -- Maybe create a separate group / listing for private and public repositories

From a security standpoint, we should also only allow admins to make a repository public (instead of repository creator).
fields.summary: Make private / public repository status more visible (BB-13095)

fields.description: If I change/upgrade a submodule, this change isn't shown in the commit view.
fields.summary: Submodule change not shown in commit (BB-13098)

fields.description: Bitbucket already nicely shows a link to a submodule. But it always seems to show the hash and not a friendly name like a tag or a branch. The name shown should work like git describe, that would seem like the simplest approach and the most correct.
fields.summary: Show tag name for submodules (BB-13096)

fields.description:
I have enabled a post hook to integrate with MyGet which acts as our build tool.

The post hook triggers MyGet to start a build from the master branch.

MyGet is configured to tag the repository with the build number after a successful build.

When the tag is received a post hook is fired.

MyGet then starts another build and the process repeats endlessly!

Is there a way to prevent post hooks firing when a repo is tagged?

Thanks,\\
Nick
fields.summary: Post Hook to MyGet causes endless build loop!

fields.description:
Kind: Bug\\
Short description: File extension of a file added via drag&drop is changed if the "language" is changed.\\
Fix: If an existing file is added via drag&drop, then it had its extension for a good reason. The snippet tool must not change the extension of files that existed before and that were added via drag&drop.

Long desription:\\
When you add an existing file via drag&drop to a snippet, and then change the language for syntax highlighting to any value (like "XML"), the snippet tool changes the file's extension to .xml (or the respective extension of that "language").

This is a bug, because the file existed before with a given extension (like ".snippet" when you add Visual Studio Code Snippets to the... Snippets tool).\\
When I now clone the snippet back local, all files have a ".xml" extension and Visual Studio no longer accepts them as snippets.\\
I had to rename them manually back to .snippet to get this working and worth making it accessible for the Team so we all share the same VS snippets.
fields.summary: snippet tool - drag&drop - change language - extension changes - this is wrong (BB-13099)

fields.description:
It should be possible to edit/change the pull request author.

Use case: When a developer has signaled (e.g., via JIRA issue status) that a branch is ready for review but forgotten to create a pull request, the reviewer should be able to create a pull request and then change its author to the developer. Without the ability to edit, the reviewer has to pick from two or three bad options:

# delay the review until the developer creates a pull request (may take a few days!)
# create a pull request with reviewer as an author, which allows the review to proceed but screws up subsequent interaction in many ways
# review the branch without creating a pull request, which means review comments are going to be attached to individual branch commits (among other problems).
fields.summary: Ability to edit pull request author

fields.description:
This is esentially the same as issue BCLOUD-3506 and BCLOUD-8089 which were closed, even though the issue has *not* been resolved.

Basically, pull requests (PRs) can become completely useless garbage without any way to clean them up.  For example, if one strips out the changesets in a repo corresponding to the PR.

There are many use-cases for non-publishing repos where one would like to use pull requests, but occasionally one needs to amend a changeset and redo the request. This leads to useless PRs like [this one|https://bitbucket.org/mforbes/mmfutils/pull-request/4] which gives the message "Nothing to merge. The source repository was deleted or these changes already exist in the destination repository."  My only solution was to open redundant PR's leaving the old garbage.

Please provide a simple way for administrators to delete mistaken PRs or reopen BCLOUD-3506 and migrate this there.
fields.summary: Allow Pull Requests to be deleted or edited. (BB-13565)

fields.description:

fields.summary: Enable rich rendering of Jupyter notebooks (BB-12986)

fields.description:
This is for "Quick Subtasks for Jira" plugin.  This link made me open an account with you to create a enhancment request.  https://bitbucket.org/hascode/jira-quick-subtasks/issues?status=new&status=open

We have 6 types of Sub tasks in our jira instance.  In the Quick Subtasks plugin, it is documented that you can set the issuetype for a task by appending “/ issuetype:”Bugfix Subtask”.  But, when you go to add multiple subtasks, the dialog box has an issuetype drop-down and can only be set to one value.  If the issuetype is set by appending it to the text, the drop-down value always overrides it.

This causes the user to have to separately add their subtasks based on the issuetype instead of being able to add all of them in one go regardless of issuetype.  Is this the intended functionality and the documentation is wrong, or is this a bug?  It would be very beneficial if specifying the issuetype would override the drop-down value.
fields.summary: "Quick Subtasks for Jira" plugin - Issuetype dropdown overrides issuetype setting

fields.description:
I am using the REST api (version 1) get the list of files that exists at a certain folder in my repository.\\
It is working fine when trying to access a folder that does not contain a large number of files, but when trying to access a folder containing more than 150 files (this limit might be smaller as i have not been able to check the exact number) I get an "Internal server error".

Url used: "https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/{accountname}/{repo_slug}/src/{revision}/{path}"

Navigating via the website works fine. It is just the REST Api that is showing the error.

Is there any way i  can access such a folder?
fields.summary: Rest API returns error when trying to read a folder with 150+ files (BB-12989)

fields.description:
[reST|http://docutils.sourceforge.net/rst.html] does not [specify|http://docutils.sourceforge.net/docs/ref/rst/restructuredtext.html#hyperlink-targets] any prefix for [link fragments|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fragment_identifier] within a document. Accordingly, standard reST rendering tools (like [{{restview}}|https://pypi.python.org/pypi/restview]) used for local reST rendering (e.g., for pre-commit previewing) generate internal links without a fragment prefix. E.g., the document [{{rst_link_test/README.rst}}|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test] has a first section with name='summary'. When rendering the table of contents for that document, {{restview}} creates an internal link like {{localhost/#summary}}.

However, Bitbucket's reST renderer creates internal link/anchor fragments prefixed {{#rst-header-}} rather than just {{#}}. As a result, if a user cut'n'pastes fragments from her/his local renderer into her/his reST source (e.g., creating internal links from one part of her/his documentation to another), the links will resolve/navigate correctly when rendered locally, but will fail when pushed to or rendered by BB.
fields.summary: reStructuredText: link fragments {require, are created with} non-standard prefix='#rst-header-' (BB-12993)

fields.description:
Trying to add an ssh key, after clicking on "Add Key", the ui give no feedback. Looking at the console I get the following:

POST https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/users/kbenoit/ssh-keys 500 (INTERNAL SERVER ERROR)nrWrapper @ (index):5Z.ajaxTransport.Q.cors.e.crossDomain.send @ jquery.js:8625Z.extend.ajax @ jquery.js:8161u @ bitbucket.js:199i.user.t.add_ssh_key @ bitbucket.js:865i.onCreate @ ssh-keys.js:24l @ form.js:48define._onclick @ aui-stable.js:5522Z.event.dispatch @ jquery.js:4430Z.event.add.g.handle @ jquery.js:4116nrWrapper @ (index):5\\
(index):5 Uncaught Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: {"error": {"message": "'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc3 in position 5: ordinal not in range(128)", "id": "f4887b7306f44c53901173e500a4467c"}}

Here's the key I'm trying to to add from latest chrome (42.0.2311.135) under osx:

ssh-rsa  kbenoit@GreenplayLogServer

Seems a problem with some unicode character, but neither the ssh key or the title contain non-ascii characters.
fields.summary: Internal Server Error Sending while adding an ssh key

fields.description:
As a pull request creator, I want to draw attention of the reviewers to certain files/changes in a pull request.

It would be great if I could change the order in which the changed files appear in a pull-request.

This way I can draw attention to the most critical changes at the start of a pull request.
fields.summary: Reorder the changed files in a Pull Request

fields.description:
Hello,

Thanks in advance for the solution...

We are using bitbucket from last 6 months and haven't faced problem like below:

We created a C# project using MVC 4 which creates some packages itself to use with the projects. When we uploaded the code to repo through SourceTree the DLLs contained in package folder didn't uploaded and our developer on the other side faced so many issue while running that code.

Is there something like restriction or something in the sourcetree of bitbucket that doesn't allow auto-generated DLLs to upload?

Please give your answers asap as we're not able to carry on with the project.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Required DLLs aren't uploaded on Bitbucket Repository

fields.description: xBase developers have a lack of syntax highlighters for their languages, commonly Clipper, Harbour or AdvPL. Github doesn't have full support for xBase-based nor Harbour, but has the possibility of defining them; however, Bitbucket has the nearest support, counting with FoxPro.
fields.summary: Add Clipper (xBase) programming language (BB-12997)

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to get a side by side diff that has more text shown on either side.  There seems to be a maximum size for the window and it does not auto-resize with the browser window resize.

fields.description: The "patience diff" algorithm can show better differences and is available via the git command git diff --patience.  It would be nice to make this available to the GUI based diffs as well, perhaps configurable on a per-user or per-instance basis when generating diffs.
fields.summary: Allow for "patience diff" differences display. (BB-12998)

fields.description:
Step 5. Mercurialで SSH圧縮を有効にする\\
SSHを利用してデータの送受信を行うとき、 Gitはデータを圧縮しています。Mercurialは自動では圧縮を行いません。いくらかの場合に大幅なスピードアップにつながるので、SSH圧縮を有効にした方がいいでしょう。Mercurialで圧縮を有効にするには次のようにします:

ターミナルウィンドウを開きます。\\
Mercurial共通設定ファイル (~/.hgrc) を編集します。\\
UIセクションに次の行を追加します:
fields.summary: それが完了するとファイルは次のようになっているでしょう:

fields.description:
標準では、システムは IDのすべての秘密鍵・公開鍵 /Users/yourname/.ssh ディレクトリに追加します。次の処理は既定の IDを作成します。

ローカルシステムのターミナルを開きます。\\
コマンドラインから ssh-keygenと入力します。\\
コマンドがファイルの保存場所を聞いてきます。もし .sshディレクトリがなくても、システムは自動的に作成してくれます。\\
既定の場所（/Users/yourname/.ssh/id_rsa）にするため、空のまま Enterを押します。\\
プロンプトが表示されたら、パスフレーズを入力し、確認のために再度入力します。\\
（パスフレーズは空にもできますが）スクリプトのような処理のためのキーを必要としない限り、パスフレーズは設定すべきです。コマンドは既定の IDをその公開鍵・秘密鍵とともに作成します。これまでの操作で次のよう画面になっているでしょう:
fields.summary: 標準では、システムは IDのすべての秘密鍵・公開鍵 /Users/yourname/.ssh

fields.description:
Bitbucketを使用したり、設定するときに役立つようなTips、裏技、良く聞かれる質問などをまとめています:

チーム機能FAQ\\
コミットメッセージに間違ったユーザー名が表示されるのはなぜですか？\\
リポジトリ/ファイル/アップロードのサイズにはどんな制限がありますか？\\
Bitbucketがパスワードを求めてきますが、私は OpenIDでログインしています\\
Bitbucketアカウントに公開鍵をインストールする方法\\
MercurialとGitはどのバージョンをサポートしていますか？\\
リポジトリを削除したのに、ダッシュボードにまだ見えています。どうなっているの？\\
DVCSはほかのバージョン管理システムと何が異なりますか？\\
BitbucketでWebサイトを公開する\\
リポジトリの書き込み不可モード\\
私の GitBash SSH環境では毎回パスフレーズを聞いてきます、どうすればいいですか？\\
Soucetreeではどのように SSHの設定をすればいいですか？\\
どうすればリポジトリを削除した後で、設定されていたリダイレクトURLを削除することができますか？\\
Bitbucket 上のコードはどれくらい安全ですか? サービスは信頼できますか?\\
リポジトリからタグを除外または削除するにはどうすればいいですか？\\
私のリポジトリで git gc (保全作業) を実行する必要がありますか？\\
Bitbucketはどのブラウザーをサポートしていますか？\\
Bitbucketでは私のリポジトリをバックアップしていますか？\\
同じブランチに複数ヘッドを pushできますか？\\
アカデミックライセンスはどのように機能しますか？\\
Bitbucketとはなにか\\
Mercurialとはなにか\\
hgとはなにか\\
コミットに使うMercurialのユーザ名を設定する\\
READMEのテキストをBitbucketのSourceタブに表示する\\
Bitbucketでドキュメントを公開する
fields.summary: Mercurialとはなにか

fields.description:
SSH key is unable to be added if Bitbucket is not in English. Pressing 'Add key' on the Add SSH key window will not do anything. The developer console will show an error 500.

Setting Bitbucket back to English and adding a SSH key works fine.
fields.summary: SSH key cannot be added if Bitbucket is not set in English (BB-12876)
